title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=ae6b7a10fa3272821e9904431dab0b993b36aae7
comments:
Caution :  All films mentioned here deal with adult themes...

Drive my car (Japanese) - A sublime and thought-provoking drama

The Worst person in the world (Norwegian) - This one is hard to describe in a couple of lines but if you want to watch something fresh, indie and well written, give this a try. Some may find this a bit depressing and sad in second half.

Birdman (Eng.) - some may find this one overrated, but that ending though...Also excellent cinematography...

Spotlight(Eng.) - Only if India had journalism like this...

The Big Lebowski(Eng.) - a Coen brothers' classic.   
  
Entergalactic(Eng.) - Mind you this one is an adult animated film. The soundtrack and the animation blend well really nicely.
TVF pitcher  season 2 , Mili, Jack Ryan season 3. All are decent and entertaining watch.

Jaya jaya jaya jaya hey - absolutely hilarious

  


The pale blue eye - very good period mystery thriller after a very long time

  


Kooman - by jeethu Joseph - it was good but not to the level of drishyam, too many twists and story completely went down a different path in second half

  


Sri dhanya catering service - decent one time watch - comedy

Glass onion - knives out sequel - really good whodunit
